Description: FDA’s Oncology Center of Excellence (OCE) has placed a renewed focus on ensuring that the doses of cancer drugs are optimized for efficacy as well as safety and tolerability. Evaluation of tolerability is vital to achieve dose optimization, and patient-generated data are essential to an assessment of tolerability. This session will review the importance of clinical trial design and clinical data in assessing tolerability, discuss types of patient-generated data which can support dose optimization, examine how to incorporate patient-generated data into trials intended for dose optimization, and include case examples. This session is a collaboration between FDA OCE’s Patient-Focused Drug Development program and FDA OCE’s Project Optimus.
